void ParticleManager::BiuldWallParticles ( Hydrodynamics &  hydro,
Initiation &  ini,
Boundary &  boundary 
) [private]

buid the initial wall particles and the linked lists

left hand border (corresponds to the first column)

  • iterate over the first colums of all cells that constitute this boundary

    • create a new wall particle

    • insert its position on the particle list

    • insert the position into corresponding cell list

right hand border(corresponds to the last column)

  • iterate over the last colums of all cells that constitute this boundary

    • create a new wall particle

    • insert its poistion on the particle list

    • insert the position into corresponding cell list

lower border(corresponds to the lowest row)

  • iterate over the lowest row of all cells that constitute this boundary

    • creat a new wall particle

    • insert its poistion on the particle list

    • insert the position into corresponding cell list

upper border (corresponds to the last row)

  • iterate over the last rows of all cells that constitute this boundary

    • create a new wall particle

    • insert its poistion on the particle list

    • insert the position into corresponding cell list

Here is the call graph for this function:

void ParticleManager::BuildInteraction ( Llist< Interaction > &  interactions,
Llist< Particle > &  particle_list,
Force **  forces,
QuinticSpline &  weight_function 
)

build the interaction (particle pair) list

  • iterate particles on the particle list

    • choose origin particle

    • find out where(in which cell) the particle is

    • loop on this and all surrounding cells

      • iterate this cell list

        • calculate distance between particle in question and destination particle (which is iterated)and if interaction takes place: add pair to inetraction list (question: why is dst compared to h^2 and not support length to determine if there is interaction or not??

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void ParticleManager::BuildNNP ( Vec2d &  point  ) 

do NNP search around a point and build the NNP list

  • clear the list first

  • loop on this and all surrounding cells

    • iterate this cell list

      • check the position of the particle and (if particle is NNP) insert the nearest particle to the list

      • (line 137)Question: WHY SMOOTHINGLENGTH AND NOT SUPPORT LENGT???

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void ParticleManager::BuildNNP_MLSMapping ( Vec2d &  point  ) 

do NNP search around a point and build the NNP list for MLS approximation

  • loop on this and all surrounding cells

    • iterate this cell list

      • check the position of the real particle and (if particle is NNP) insert it to the list

Here is the call graph for this function:

void ParticleManager::UpdateCellLinkedLists (  ) 

update the cell linked lists for real particles

  • (double) loop (as indices i, j) on all cells

    • iterate this cell list

    • if the list is empty or the node position is at the end !!!Question!!! is this comment right? would it not rather be...if list NOT empty and NOT at the end

      • check the position of the real particle

        • if the partilce runs out of the current cell

          • delete the current node

          • insert it to the new cell linked list
